intro: Cota tinctoria subsp. fussii, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers, which bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and useful in traditional dyeing practices.
